data.title: What was the original capital of Arizona?
authors: LOVELY Jennie Alena Kati  ** HAIL TO A BRAND NEW YEAR;
data.meta_description: Time to challenge yourself. Click here to answer this question and others on QuizzClub.com

data.text: Tucson is a city in and the county seat of Pima County, Arizona, United States, and home to the University of Arizona. From August 1861 to mid-1862, Tucson was the western capital of the Confederate Arizona Territory, the eastern capital being Mesilla. In 1862 the California Column drove the Confederate forces out of Arizona. Tucson and all of what is now Arizona was part of New Mexico Territory until 1863, when it became part of the new Arizona Territory. From 1867 to 1877, Tucson was the capital of the Arizona Territory.
